intro: Pergularia brevituba, commonly known as the short-stemmed pogostemon, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple and are arranged in whorls along the stem. Pergularia brevituba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
